More Notes: Î²1 is the marginal direct effect of an additional dry spell day across all cropped areas in a country on growth in the FAO CPI. This value is unknown from this page, but is a regression coefficient that would appear as a number in the actual results.
FAO CPI used as a proxy for crop production. Effect is interpreted as direct effect of dry spells due to conditioning on drought. Based on 1979-2016 data.
The main effect of an additional day in a 28+ day dry spell on growth in crop production is negative. Study period 1979-2016.

Effect of an additional dry spell day in current year. Specification includes 28+ day dry spells and 9+ day heat waves. p<0.05. Year is end of time series.
Effect of an additional dry spell day with a 1-year lag. Specification includes 28+ day dry spells and 9+ day heat waves. p<0.1. Year is end of time series - 1 year.

Minimum dry spell duration of 28 days and a minimum heat wave duration of 9 days.  Weighted temporally using cropped area by month from MIRCA2000. p<0.05
Minimum dry spell duration of 28 days and a minimum heat wave duration of 9 days.  SPEI is quantified just prior to the first of the 90-hottest day per cell. p<0.05
Minimum dry spell duration of 28 days and a minimum heat wave duration of 9 days. Adjust for counts of days in 10F temperature bins in addition to average temperature. p<0.05
Minimum dry spell duration of 28 days and a minimum heat wave duration of 9 days. Cubic precipitation and temperature terms. p<0.05
Minimum dry spell duration of 28 days and a minimum heat wave duration of 9 days. Linear rather than quadratic per-country trends. p<0.05
Minimum dry spell duration of 28 days and a minimum heat wave duration of 9 days. Cubic rather than quadratic per-country trends. p<0.05
Minimum dry spell duration of 28 days and a minimum heat wave duration of 9 days. Add 1-year lags of all environmental variables. p<0.05
Minimum dry spell duration of 28 days and a minimum heat wave duration of 9 days. Add lagged log value added per capita in agriculture, fisheries, and forestry.
Minimum dry spell duration of 28 days and a minimum heat wave duration of 9 days. Same as (9) but instrument for the added term using lagged log GDP per capita.
Minimum dry spell duration of 28 days and a minimum heat wave duration of 9 days. Use log of value added per capita in agriculture, fisheries, and forestry as an alternate outcome.
